channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Netflix co-CEO Ted Sarandos argues its Warner Bros. deal won’t hurt consumers. If so, they can cancel with one click
item.description: Sarandos defended Netflix’s Warner Bros. merger and argued customers hold the real power.

item.title: USAID division killed by Trump is reborn after 2 mysterious donors give $48 million
item.description: "It’s wonderful that private funders have stepped up to help try to fill part of that gap but it’s only filling part of the gap.”

item.title: U.S. Seeks to Expedite Deportation of 5-Year-Old Liam Conejo Ramos
item.description: Liam was detained last month near Minneapolis during an immigration enforcement operation in which his father was also taken into custody by federal a...

item.title: Trump Deletes Racist Video Portraying the Obamas as Apes
item.description: The White House press secretary had dismissed criticism of the clip’s racist content as “fake outrage.” But later Friday, the clip disappeared from th...

item.title: Dow soars by 1,200 points to top 50,000 for the first time as chipmakers and airlines lead ferocious stock market rebound
item.description: Even with Friday’s surge, the S&P 500 still fell to its third losing week in the last four.

item.title: Anthropic’s newest model excels at finding security vulnerabilities—but raises fresh cybersecurity risks
item.description: Claude Opus 4.6 identified over 500 previously unknown 'zero day' vulnerabilities, according to Anthropic security experts

item.title: Minneapolis fourth grader says ICE fears leave his 30-person class with just 7 students: ‘The teachers cry’
item.description: For many immigrant families in Minnesota, sending a child to school requires faith that federal immigration officers deployed around the state won’t d...

item.title: Moderates Pitch Tough-on-Crime Message for Democrats Amid Immigration Talks
item.description: A polling memo circulated among centrist senators urged Democrats to talk tougher on crime, an issue where they lag Republicans, while noting an oppor...

item.title: Paul Weiss Partners Turned on Brad Karp After Learning Extent of His Epstein Ties
item.description: Mr. Karp resigned as chairman of the elite law firm after senior partners met to decide his future.

item.title: In the Grip of Gangs, Haiti Faces a Government Leadership Vacuum
item.description: The tenure of a presidential council that has been running Haiti expires on Saturday. It’s unclear what will come next.

item.title: JD Vance Is Booed at Winter Olympics Opening Ceremony in Milan
item.description: Before the event, protesters marched in Milan in opposition to U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement, whose personnel are in Italy to advise local ...

item.title: Saalumarada Thimmakka Dies; Planted and Nurtured Thousands of Trees
item.description: Believed to be 113, she spent decades building an environmental legacy in India, inspired by her grief at being unable to conceive children.

item.title: Talks With U.S. Were ‘Good Start,’ Iran’s Foreign Minister Says
item.description: Abbas Araghchi, the minister, said the two sides had agreed to continue negotiations at a later date. The U.S. delegation had yet to comment.
